query.comment: Always for all paths the model doesn't incur into deadlock state

query.formula: A[] (Initializer.init_over imply (sum(x : station_t) not Station(x).waiting) + (sum(i : belt_t ) sum(j : belt_pos_t) belts[i][j]) == sum(k : belt_t) belt_conf[k].pieces)
query.comment: Always for all paths, once initilized, the pieces in the system remain the same,this also verify that two pieces never overlap or a station never holds more than one piece

query.formula: A[] (Initializer.init_over imply forall(i : belt_t) forall(j : belt_pos_t) 0 <= belts[i][j] < 2)
query.comment: Always for all paths it never happens that in the belt two pieces overlap

query.formula: A[] (Initializer.init_over imply forall(i : belt_t) ((sum(j : belt_pos_t) belts[i][j])<=Belt.max_queue(i)))
query.comment: Always for all paths the pieces on the belts are within the queue length once the system in initialized

query.formula: A[] (Initializer.init_over imply forall(i : station_t) not Station(i).waiting imply belts[Station(i).input()][0] == 0)
query.comment: For all paths when a station is processing the slot before it is always free of pieces aka the station never process more than one piece at a time
In order: - total pieces in the system - pieces on belt - pieces being processed
